metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2735 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in the PCS project. This issue occurs due to incorrect permissions on a Unix socket used for internal communication between PCS daemons. A privilege escalation could happen by obtaining an authentication token for a hacluster user. With the "hacluster" token, this flaw allows an attacker to have complete control over the cluster managed by PCS.

criterions.comment: pcs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
